Solicita el crédito para invertir para comprar dos  aros, 1  gata, 2 llantas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los repuestos y trabajar sin ningún inconveniente.

Las compras lo hará en Quito. El sueño  es poder seguir progresando y tener una casa,  además de sacar adelante los estudios de la segunda hija. 

El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar duro y diariamente para el bienestar de la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, hacer deporte
texts.en:
Jorge Manuel, 60, is married and has two daughters.  He lives with his daughters, 24 and 16, and his wife in Quito, province of Pichincha.  Jorge is a taxi driver for a taxi company.  He makes trips throughout the city.

He is requesting the loan to invest in buying two rims, a jack, and two tires.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the parts and to work without any problem.  He will make the purchase in Quito.

His dream is to be able to continue getting ahead and to have a house, as well as to give his second daughter a good start in her studies.  The challenge he faces is to work hard every day for the well-being of his family.  In his free time he likes to read and play sports.

loans.use: to buy two rims, a jack, and two tires.

loans.name: Sedjro 3 Group

texts.fr: SEDJRO 3 est un groupe constitué de cinq personnes dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante, (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pélagie. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pélagie est âgée 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Wilfrid. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pélagie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Pélagie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Pélagie vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique depuis près de quatre ans. Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Pélagie et à son groupe SEDJRO 3 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le premier crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group SEDJRO 3 consists of five members who are also friends. They are seeking a second loan from ALIDé to bolster their working capital. The group’s representative is Pélagie, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Pélagie, age 31, is married to a man named Wilfrid. The couple have two dependent children, both in school. Pélagie lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together. Pélagie attended high school.

To help provide for the family’s needs, Pélagie has been selling hair extensions and cosmetic products out of a shop for nearly four years. She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

This loan will help Pélagie and the other members of SEDJRO 3 to strengthen their activities, to expand their customer base, and to increase their revenue. The previous loan they obtained was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
This borrower, from Iraq, is 45 years old, married and has five children. Since 2002, Kamel has owned a shop selling spare parts for cars. With ten years of experience in this field, he enjoys a good reputation and is well-known in the area.

Kamel is requesting a $2100 loan in order to make additional shelves and pay for an advertising lighting box and an aluminum showcase. He is striving to earn more profits to provide a better life for his entire family.

loans.use: to make additional shelves and pay for an advertising lighting box and an aluminum showcase.

loans.name: Carlos Ramon

texts.es:
Carlos Ramón tiene 23 años de edad, tiene dos hijos es casado vive en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

Carlos Ramón es maestro da Inglés en una escuela primaria. 
Solicita el crédito para realizar arreglos en su vivienda para comprar puertas, ventanas, cambiar el techo, etc.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar su vivienda haciendo los arreglos requeridos.

El sueño es poder comprar un vehículo para la familia.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguirse superando cada día para el bienestar propio y de su familia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar deporte como jugar futbol y vóley boll.
texts.en:
Carlos Ramón, 23, has two children; he’s married and lives in the city of Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  He works as an English teacher.  

He’s asking for a loan to do some home improvements like installing doors, windows, replacing the roof, etc.  With help from the loan he will be able to do the needed improvements.  

His dream is to be able to buy a vehicle for the family.  The challenge he faces is to continue improving himself every day for his and his family’s wellbeing.  In his free time he likes playing sports like soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to purchase doors, windows, and to change the roof of his home

loans.name: Norma Rocio

texts.es:
Norma Roció tiene 24 años de edad es soltera vive con sus familiares en Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.
Norma Roció es empleada domestica.

Solicita el crédito para la compra un computador y una impresora para facilitar la realización de los trabajos  requeridos en sus estudios.
La compra del producto la realizarà en la ciudad de Guaranda.
Su sueño es ponerse su propio Cyber para beneficio personal.
Los desafíos a los cuales se enfrenta es la culminación de sus estudios  siendo reconocida como una excelente alumna.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte como básquet etc.
texts.en:
Norma Roció, 24, is single and lives with her family in Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.
Norma Roció is a domestic employee.
She is requesting this loan to buy a computer so she can do the homework required in her studies. 
She will purchase the equipment in Guaranda. 
Her dream is to start her own internet services business for personal gain.
The challenge she faces is being recognized as an excellent student when she finishes her studies. 
In her spare time, she enjoys sports like basketball.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El Sr. Milciades es soltero, y aun no tiene hijos. Tiene un pequeño taller ubicado en la ciudad de Lambaré, empezó de muy niño trabajando con su padre que también tiene la misma profesión.
Empezó pasando herramientas a su padre y sus compañeros, luego de a poco y mientras pasaban los años su padre le fue enseñando todos los secretos de la mecánica automotriz. Ya en el año 2008 se decide y se independiza, empezando con pocas herramientas pero muchas ganas de trabajar. De a poco y gracias a su trabajo está logrando equipar su negocio.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de un compresor, el cual lo quiere utilizar en su taller para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milciades is single and still does not have children.  He has a small shop located in the city of Lambaré.  When he was very young he began working with his father, who also has the same profession.

He began handing tools to his father and his coworkers.  Then, little by little and as the years passed, his father began teaching him all the secrets of auto repair.  Finally, in 2008, he made up his mind and became independent, beginning with few tools but a lot of desire to work.  Gradually, and thanks to his work, he is managing to equip his business.

He is requesting the loan to buy a compressor, which he will use in his shop to be able to give his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his shop.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El comite de reseda son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son muy unidas es un grupo muy antiguo y ellas son muy trabajadoras y unidas por sobre todo se ayudan siempre y en el barrio mismo. Semanalmente se reunen para los pagos y actividades que van realizando cada mes.
Vicenta es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de plantas. Comenta que tiene una gran variedad de plantas que son solicitadas por muchas personas. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas silvestres, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes para la venta.
texts.en:
All of the members of the committee named "Reseda" are from the District of San Lorenzo. Being a long-time group, the members are very close. They are hard workers who always help one another and those in their neighborhood. The members meet on a weekly basis to submit their payments and plan the activities that they will carry out each month.

Vicenta is the group president. She says that she sells all types of plants. Vicenta offers a wide variety of plants that are requested by many people. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move forward and help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wild plants, which will provide greater variety that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy wild plants to sell.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se unieron con el deseo de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras. 
La sra. Lilian tiene un comercio de lenceria y electronica vive con sus hijas de14 años y de 11 años . Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y no tiene miedo a ningun trabajo es por ello que hace de todo.  Ella solicita  el credito  para la compra de productos varios, como ser  ropas, lenceria, celulares y articulo de electronicas, con lo cual podrá tener una buena cantidad de productos en stock.
Lilian tiene como meta ir agrandando su negocio y  brindando asi un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
15 women from the city of Luque got together with the hope of working and helping each other.

Mrs. Lilian has a lingerie and electronic store. She lives with her two daughters who are 14 and 11 years old. She is a very hard worker and is not afraid of any type of work which is why she does everything. Mrs. Lilian needs the loan to buy different products like clothing, lingerie, cell phones, and electronic products which will allow her to have more good quality merchandize in stock.

As a goal, Lilian wants to keep improving her business and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy different products like clothing, lingerie, cell phones, electronic products, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está empezando pero se la buena predisposición de todas para formarse y realizar actividades juntas.   Todas son vecinas y no tienen ningún problema para reunirse y realizar actividades para el progreso de todas. El objetivo de cada una es poder salir adelante en cada una de sus actividades y también poder sobresalir como grupo. 
Mirtha es una de las miembros, ella es muy trabajadora y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que últimamente el carbón es muy solicitado. Mirtha nos comenta que su sueño es poder seguir progresando y de esa forma poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, para poder tener en stock y que no le falte para cuando sus clientes se lo pidan.
texts.en:
The committee is now beginning but they are happy to be forming the group and having businesses together.  All are neighbors and don't have any problems meeting and working for everyone's progress.  Each one has the objective of getting ahead in their businesses and also to succeed as a group.
Mirtha is one of the members.  She is very hardworking and tells us that she sells charcoal.  She has a good customer base since lately charcoal is in much demand. She says that her dream is to continue progressing and in that way to be able to improve her earnings and to keep on helping her family.
She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal so that she will have stock and be able to supply her customers when they order.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras un grupo formado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Asunción. Son madres de familia y cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 1º ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad de todas ellas.
Maria es miembro del grupo, y ella comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de plásticos, aluminio, papeles, cartones y demás artículos reciclados. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plásticos, cartones, y papel en cantidad, lo cual revenderá y de esa forma podrá tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mujeres Trabajadoras (Hard-working Women) is a group made up of 12 women in the city of Asunción. They are mothers and heads of their households and daily sacrifice a lot so they can get ahead. This group is currently in their first loan cycle where they can prove their responsibility.

Maria is a member of the group and she shares that she works recycling plastic, aluminum, paper, cardboard, and other recyclable items. She describes herself as a very hard-working person with a desire to get ahead through her work. She shares she is very proud of what she does, since it is a dignified and honest job. She is asking for a loan to buy plastics, cardboard, and paper in bulk, which she will resell to earn more earnings.

loans.use: buy plastic, cardboard, and paper in bulk

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El Señor. Ismael tiene 56 años, vive en de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está casado con la Señora María con quien tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos ya mayores.
El Señor Ismael nos comentó que empezó a trabajar en construcción hace aproximadamente 30 años, empezó como ayudante albañil y hace 20 años que empezó a trabajar en forma independiente por toda la zona de Paraguarí y alrededores. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de seguir trabajando para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Solicitó el préstamo para el cambio de su vehículo, ya que es su medio de transporte a la hora de hacer sus trabajos y le facilitará mucho al transportar sus herramientas.
texts.en:
Ismael is 56 years old and lives in the city of Paraguarí. He is married to María, with whom he has five children, all of which are grown up. Ismael started to work in construction approximately 30 years ago. He started as an assistant bricklayer and twenty years ago he started to work independently in the zone of Paraguarí and the surrounding areas. He is a very hardworking person and wishes to continue working to help cover the household expenses.

He requested the loan to get a new vehicle, since it is how he gets around to do his work and it would make his work easier to be able to transport his tools.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras, por medio del trabajo en conjunto. 
Isabel forma parte de este grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que la ropa de segunda mano es muy solicitada últimamente porque es más económica. Isabel quiere seguir trabajando y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee named "Kuña Guapa" is from the city of Curuguaty. They are in their first loan cycle with the Program of Women Entrepreneurs at Fundación Paraguaya. These women have tremendous desire to succeed and help one another. They perform their work together as a group.

Isabel is a member of this group and says that she sells used clothing of all types. She has done very well since lately there has been plenty of demand for secondhand clothing because it is more affordable. Isabel wants to continue working, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes. She will be able to continue her work and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
El Sr. Néstor  tiene 35 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Ana de 38 años, tienen un hijo de  4 años y viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Néstor cuando tenía 10 años de edad quedó mudo lamentablemente pero con el esfuerzo de su madre logró seguir estudiando hasta graduarse como peluquero profesional en una institución  especial, hoy en día está feliz trabajando en su propia peluquería con clientela formada.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de muebles para peluquería como ser silla, espejo y otros, lo cual le será de gran ayuda para poder hacer su trabajo y de esa forma seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Néstor, 35, is married to Ana, 38, and they have a 4-year-old son.  They live in the city of Carapeguá.  When Néstor was ten years old, unfortunately he lost his speaking ability, but with his mother's efforts he was able to graduate from professional beauty school at a special institution.  Today he is happy working in his own salon with a fixed customer base.

He is requesting a loan to buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his shop, which will help him in his work so he can continue getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his barber shop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad lives in Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has one child. Since 2005, he has earned a living by running a shop where he sells perfumes and accessories for women. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He is also well known in the area where he lives. He is applying for a $3,000 loan to install a sliding door and display case, and to buy an electrical generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to install a sliding door and display case and buy an electrical generator.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa  tiene  62 y está casada con el  Sr. Pablino con quien tiene tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad con sus respectivas familias. Una de sus hijas está trabajando en España y le ayuda enviándole dinero para colaborar  con los gastos de la casa.                                                         
La Sra. Tomasa hace diez años que tiene una Mercería ambulante donde vende todo tipo de productos, y en su casa tiene una despensa  la cual atiende su esposo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que no teme al trabajo ni a los desafíos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de Otoño Invierno, con lo cual podrá tener buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Comenta que más adelante desea ampliar su negocio hasta  que llegue a un Autoservice.
texts.en:
Señora Tomasa is 62 years old and is married to Señor Pablino, with whom she has three children, all of whom are now adults with their own families. One of her daughters is working in Spain and helps her by sending her money to help with the household expenses.

For ten years Señora Tomasa has had an itinerant clothing business where she sells all types of products, and in her house she has a convenience store that her husband tends to. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who does not fear work or challenges.

She is applying for the loan to buy fall and winter clothing, so that she will have a good variety to offer her customers. She comments that in the future she wants to expand her store until it becomes a self-service store.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el amor que una madre tiene hacia sus hijos, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es una ciudad ubicada en la hermosa selva peruana, se caracteriza por su flora y fauna diversa así como también la generosidad y  amabilidad de sus pobladores. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollos”, asimismo cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con el más pequeño de sus hijos que tiene 3 años, ya que los mas son mayores de edad. Griselda solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho optimismo Griselda se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida, golosinas y bebidas; ella trabaja alrededor de 12  horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque da una buena atención a sus clientes.

Griselda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le, han brindado ella podrá comprar mesas, sillas, vitrinas, utensilios de cocina entre otros, con esta mejora ella dará una mejor atención a sus clientes y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Tener un restaurante grande”.
texts.en:
Griselda is a very hardworking woman. She is a single mother of 4 children, whom she provides for with great dedication and above all with the love a mother has for he children. Her house is located in Pucallpa, a town located in the beautiful Peruvian rain forest, and characterized by its animals and plants as well as by the generosity and kindness of its inhabitants. Being a good Peruvian, she likes the typical dishes of our country, one of her favorite being the delicious “arroz con pollos” (chicken rice); and whenever she has some free time, she likes going for a walk with her youngest child, aged 3, as the others are older. Girselda studied only up to the fifth year of secondary school, but she would have loved to study to become a nurse.

Full of optimism, Griselda engages in her retailing activity, selling food, sweets and drinks; she works around 12 hours a day, and she can serve up to 25 customers. She believes things are going well with her activity because she tends to her customers with good care.

Griselda is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy tables, chairs, showcases and cooking tools among other items. Thanks to this improvement she will provide her customer with a better service and she will succeed in increasing her earnings, thus keeping on fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “to own a big restaurant”.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, showcases and cooking tools.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 32 years old, married, and has three children, one of  whom works. He is from Iraq. Since 2010, Hussein has owned a workshop, manufacturing advertising light boxes. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and a deep understanding of the local customers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

Hussein is requesting a loan for $2,400 loan, which he will use to install sliding doors and showcases. He is aiming to earn more profits and provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to install sliding doors and showcases.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
This borrower, from Iraq, is 39 years old, married, and has two children. In 2000 Kefah opened his own barbershop which offers shaving and massage services. With more than ten years of experience in this field, he enjoys a good reputation, and his shop is situated in a crowded area with a good number of customers passing by.

Kefah is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate and redecorate his shop and install a sliding door. He is aiming to increase his profits in order to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his shop and install a sliding door.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 60 years old and has two children. She has earned a living for the last 10 years by operating a beauty salon and now employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business because she has been trained on business management.  She has also learned how to save her money. Regina hopes to have a well-established business in the future. She has requested for a loan for 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair treatment and hair oil to use in her shop.

loans.use: to buy hair treatment and oil for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El Comite PORVENIR es del Chaco, está integrado por 12 mujeres muy capaces, luchadoras y por sobre todo con un gra espíritu de superación. Comienzan el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, pero desean llegar al máximo nivel.
 La  Sra Gladys es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de merceria, donde tiene todo tipo de productos, como ser ropas, artículos de bazar, sabanas, frazadas y demás. Gracias a la buena variedad de productos que tiene ha podido tener buenas ganancias y ayudar así a la economía de la casa. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como así también artículos de bazar y sabanas, ya que quiere tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group Porvenir (Future) is from Chaco and consists of 12 very capable women, full of fighting spirit and the will to overcome difficulties. They are in their first cycle of loans with the programme of the Field Partner that helps women who have a business, and they hope to continue on further cycles with the Field Partner. Gladys is one of the members of Porvernir; she has a small shop where she sells all kinds of products, such as clothes, general store items, sheets, and coverlets. Thanks to the diversity of products she sells, she was able to make good money and thus help with household expenses. She asks for this loan to buy clothes, general store supplies and sheets, since she wants to be able to offer her customers a decent choice.

loans.use: to buy clothes, general store supplies and sheets.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 37 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite, the Philippines. She is married to a cook and is the mother of three children. She earns a living by running a variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to people who live in her neighborhood. Her store is located next to her house. She also operates a transportation business for additional income. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to sell to her customers. She expects a boost in her income from this loan, and hopes to continue expanding her business in coming years to give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet to study religion and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cuidad de Caacupé. Son personas con muchas ganas de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias y la de sus hijos.
Salvadora es miembro del grupo, y ella comenta que es modista, ella se dedica a esto hace ya un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que siempre le dan trabajo para hacer. Ella se define como una persona con gran capacidad, y que no tiene miedo a los desafíos, es por ello que no se cansa de luchar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradecen a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en: The women of this group are from the town of Caacupé. They all share a burning desire of improving their families' and their children's living conditions. Salvadora is a member of this group; she tells us that she has been a dressmaker for quite some time and thus has a lot of customers that always give her work. She defines herself as someone very willing to work and unafraid of challenges, and that is why she never tires from the fight. She asks for this loan to buy cloth, thread, elastic thread, buttons and other supplies, with which she will be able to continue working and fulfilling the orders her customers place. The group thanks the Field Partner and Kiva for granting this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastic thread, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 47 and lives in Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to a farmer and the mother of four children. She earns a living by running a business where she sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through brands like Avon and Fuller Life. She pays cash for her goods and then gives customers one month to pay. Her dealer prices are lower than those in the catalog, and that is how she earns a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy items and products to sell. She expects a boost in her income from this loan, and hopes to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to finish their studies and graduate school one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for items and products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old, married and has six children.  To earn a living, she does poultry farming.  She has been in the business for nine years.  She has employed two people in the business.
Judith is grateful to Faulu Kenya for supporting her financially because she has been able to pay school fees to her children.  She has also managed to buy a water tank which she uses in her poultry farm.

Judith hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to expand her poultry house.

loans.use: to expand her poultry house

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
This is Eligio, 54, resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. He is married to Josefina, a housewife and a mother to their three children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eligio oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits everyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Eligio dreams to give his family a good future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is 39 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom works. He is from Iraq.  Since 2011, Kareem has owned a shop, selling prayer beads, wood coffin boxes, and antiques. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation, and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

Kareem is requesting a loan for $3,000 loan, which he will use to repair his shop’s floors and walls. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: to repair his shop’s floors and walls.

loans.name: La Paix 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX 1 est composé de six personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Eveline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eveline a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Eveline est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eveline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Eveline exerce depuis près d’une dizaine d’année ans la vente de condiments et de façon secondaire la vente d’akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) et de poissons frits à son domicile. Eveline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Eveline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA PAIX 1, un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group LA PAIX 1 consists of six people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The group’s representative is Eveline, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Eveline attended primary school. She is 44 and married to a man named Felix. The couple have four dependent children who all go to school. Eveline lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the household responsibilities together. 

To that end, Eveline started selling condiments about ten years ago. As a sideline, she also sells akassa (a maize-based paste) and fried fish from her home. She buys her supplies in a city of Benin.

To meet customer demand and to increase her sales and revenue, Eveline is seeking a loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group LA PAIX 1.

loans.use: to buy condiments and maize.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 71 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, ella es una mujer viuda que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 41 y 45 años.  Tienen un negocio apoyada por su hija, el cual  inició hace 22 años en otro municipio donde vivía,  ubicado a 15 minutos de su actual residencia; allí desarrolló su primera experiencia empresarial, vendiendo mercancía variada, adicionalmente fue agregando otros productos y hoy   vende no solo productos cosméticos,  bolsos tejidos y ropa, sino también pasteles y hayacas en compañía de su hija. En la actualidad está aplicando a su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante su credikiva, que es el primero que recibe,  comprará insumos para preparar pasteles, como carne, arroz, aceites, granos y tambien invertirá en perfumería en general, pues requiere invertir en mayor volumen para continuar ampliando aun su capital de trabajo, aumentar el inventario de mercancías, para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar el ingreso familiar; porque su mayor desafío es la competencia,  a la que debe afrontar con respuestas oportunas y productos que requieran sus clientes. Mientras Maria trabaja para cumplir sus metas, su negocio funciona con una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 28 días, por eso con su credikiva podrá financiará su cartera de crédito y aquí radica el éxito de su inversión además de que la hace enfocada en su mercado real y potencial.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 71 years old, lives in the municipality of Soledad. She is a widow who has 2 children, now aged 41 and 45. Aided by her daughter, she runs a business that was launched 22 years ago in a different municipality where Maria used to live.  It is now located 15 minutes from her present residence. Maria gained her initial business experience selling varied merchandise. Over time, she has added other products and today she sells not only cosmetics, woven bags and clothing, but also pastries and tamales, with her daughter's assistance. 

At present, Maria is applying for her 3rd loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, this time the 1st Kiva loan she has received. Maria will buy pastry-making supplies, including meat, rice, cooking oil, and grain. She will also invest in perfumes in general, since she needs to buy in larger volume and continue adding to her working capital by increasing her merchandise inventory, in order to increase sales and improve family income. Her greatest challenge is competition and she must provide opportune responses with products her customers like.

While Maria works to reach her goals, the business functions with an account collection turnover of 28 days. With her Kiva loan, hopefully, she will be able to finance her credit accounts and solve investment needs while focusing on her actual and potential market.

loans.use: buy supplies such as meat, rice, cooking oil, and grain for making pastries, plus fragrances in general to sell.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group comprises two hardworking women. Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her food business, which sells soft drinks like soda and passion fruit. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and fruits for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more soda and fruits for resale

loans.name: Utama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UTAMA” iniciará su segundo ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nancy. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de repuestos de autos, tejido de mantas, venta de gomas, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de lana de todo tipo, venta de papa.

La señora Nancy, indica que hace cinco años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de gorros y sombreros que viene trabajando hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de su capital, (compra de gorras y sombreros), mismo que comprará de la feria paceña y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud
texts.en:
The "Utama" communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani Regional Office. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board headed by Nancy. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them, we have: selling food, selling auto parts, knitting blankets, selling tires, selling cosmetics, selling baby clothing, selling all types of wool, selling potatoes.

Nancy indicates that five years ago she joined a communal bank in Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend. Now she has a business selling caps and hats, which she has been doing for years.

The loan that she will now receive is to increase her capital (purchase of caps and hats). She will buy them at the La Paz festival and then sell them in her sales space. This business helps her to support her family, since she is married and has four children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to purchase caps and hats

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 36-year-old farmer from the Khoni district. She is married and lives with her family - her husband Vazha and her 14-year-old daughter, who goes to school. Tea’s daughter has health problems and receives a pension from the government. Vazha serves in the army of the country. Tea is leading the family agricultural business. She has two milk cows and a calf. Tea produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. She also has a greenhouse, where she grows greens and tomatoes. Harvested products are also sold on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 laris.

Tea requested credit for purchasing a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. She has to change the old one, as it is torn and can’t keep the right temperature. Tea will also use part of the credit for purchasing fertilizers for the greenhouse. After changing the cover and fertilizing the land, Tea will get a better harvest, which will bring increased income to the family. Tea plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business, for further development of the greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover and fertilizers for the greenhouse

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is a 27 year-old, young and pensioned man. He is married and lives in one house with his parents. He has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. His father was his best teacher to learn how to look after land and raise organic crops.

Fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijani people and they use them in everyday meals. They use them fresh as well as cooked, as vegetables with meat (Dolma). His monthly income is 250 AZN and he usually sells his crop in the central bazaar.

He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizers and garden tools to improve the quality of his crop and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.es:
Nolvia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 8 y 3 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Nolvia tiene una pequeña pulpería en donde vende granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, pan, refrescos etc. Lleva trabajando en este negocio 3 años.  El objetivo con el cual inicio este negocio fue para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Manifiesta que hasta la fecha el negocio lo ha mantenido estable, gracias a los préstamos que ODEF le ha proporcionado.
Ella solicito su tercer préstamo con ODEF  de 7,000 lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios como harina, arroz, harina, frijoles, manteca, carnes, lacteos, etc. Piensa que esta inversión aumentar sus ingresos.
Su meta es trabajar en su negocio para poder darles a sus hijos el estudio necesario.
texts.en:
Nolvia, agd 34, is married and has three children, ages 12, 8, and 3.  She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Nolvia has a small store where she sells basic grains, meat, dairy products, bread, and soft drinks, etc.  She has been working in this business for three years.  Her objective in starting the business was to help her husband with the household expenses.  

She says that so far she has kept her business stable, thanks to the loans that ODEF has provided.  She requested her third loan with ODEF for 7,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy food products like flour, rice, beans, lard, meat, and dairy products, etc.  She thinks that this investment will increase her income.

Her goal is to work in her business in order to be able to give her children the education they need.

loans.use: to buy food products like flour, rice, beans, lard, meat, and dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Ilda Siomara

texts.es:
ILda, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y vive con su pareja y dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, en una aldea de Morazan, Yoro.
Ilda, desde hace 8 años que realiza su propia actividad agrícola, ella cultiva granos básicos como el maíz y frijoles. Desde cuando era joven aprendió con su padre quien le heredo un área de tierra donde realiza sus propios cultivos junto a su esposo.
El préstamo que solicita es de 3,000.00 Lempiras y lo va invertir en el mantenimiento y preparación de la tierra donde cultiva maíz y frijoles.
Su meta es ampliar el área de terreno para sacar más producción para lograr más ingresos.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario Alvarenga, quien está compuesto por 4 integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Ilda is 27 years old and married.  She lives with her life partner and their two children, ages 9 and 4, in a village in Moarazan, Yoro.

For eight years Ilda has been working in her own farming business.  She grows basic foods like corn and beans. When she was young she learned from her father.  She received some land from him, and that is where she works, together with her husband, on her own crops.

She will use the requested loan for 3,000 lempiras for the maintenance and preparation of the land where she grows corn and beans.

Her goal is to expand her land area in order to get more production.  She will do this in order to get more income.

She belongs to the Alvarenga communal bank.  It is comprised of four members who live in the same community and devote themselves to agriculture.

loans.use: to provide preparation and maintenance on the land where she grows corn and beans.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
16 mujeres de la ciudad de San Pedro se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y por medio del trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres unidas y trabajadoras que desean poder sobresalir y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y comenta que por medio de sus ventas ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles lo que ellos necesitan para el día a día. ella es un persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora y su meta es poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus familiares.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastarse y de esa forma poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. El grupo agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sixteen women from the city of San Pedro have joined together with a desire to succeed. They hope that, through working together, they will be able to help one another. They are united, hard-working women who want to be able to excel and, thus, to be able to help their families.
Blanca sells garments of every kind. She says that she has been able to help her family and cover all their daily needs with her sales. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person, and her goal is to keep growing and helping her family members.She is requesting this loan so that she can stock up and be able to offer a greater variety to her customers. The group is grateful to the Fundacion and to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy garments for sale.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como es taxista, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Flor de Maria posee desde hace 5 años un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de calzado (sandalia para damas).  Ella inicio este negocio con el objetivo de obtener un ingreso para apoyar económicamente a su familia ya que no disponía de un empleo. Comenzó sus ventas vendiendo en la ferias del agricultor, luego con las ganancias obtenidas fue comprando más producto y ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
En la actualidad solicito un préstamo con ODEF de 12,000 lempiras para comprar variedad de prendas que son más rentables y que se venden rápido como pantalones, camisas, vestidos, blusas, faldas etc. Y también comprar sandalias para damas. Considera que su negocio ha crecido bastante, pues ha visto que los clientes han aumentado debido a la variedad de mercadería.
La meta de Flor de Maria es obtener su propio local, y seguir obteniendo con ODEF los financiamientos que le  ayuden a mantener su negocio estable.
texts.en:
Flor de María, 34, is married and her husband works as a taxi driver; she has two children who are 13 and 11 years old and lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Flor de María has had a business selling second-hand clothes and footwear (women’s sandals) for five years.  She started the business with the goal of earning income to help her family economically since she didn’t have a job.  She started selling at farmers’ markets and then with profits started to buy more products and she’s been gradually growing.

At present she asked ODEF for a 12000 lempira loan to buy a variety of articles of clothing that are the most profitable and that sell quickly like pants, shirts, dresses, blouses, skirts, etc. and also to buy women’s sandals.  She feels that the business has grown considerably because she’s noticed that her customers have increased thanks to the variety of merchandise.  Flor María’s goal is to get a place of her own and to continue getting ODEF loans that will help her keep her business stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nijat

texts.en:
Nijat is 22 years old, married, and has two children. He is a very kind, hardworking, and passionate man. He raises and sells crops, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, carrots, and potatoes. Nijat also raises fruits such as apples, pears, and pomegranates.  After he finished school he chose not to follow his education and learned how to raise crops. He has three years of experience in this field.

Nijat usually sells his fruits and vegetables in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 250 AZN, which is not enough to cover the needs of his family. 

To improve his business Nijat is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to buy garden tools, fertilizers, and seeds. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy garden tools, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who is 46 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eladio, a worker, and is the mother of four children. Together with her husband and children, Yolanda manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses and her children’s studies. Yolanda operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community and she earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day. 

Yolanda is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will use her loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Yolanda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora amparo de Jesús, compra sus productos desde  las seis de la mañana posteriormente se traslada a su  puesto de venta para su comercialización donde finaliza a las cuatro de la tarde. Ella realiza este tipo de trabajo para la mantención de su hogar ya que es madre soltera de cuatro  hijos.
 
 Este crédito lo esta solicitando  para la compra de productos tales como agua, gaseosas, caramelos, chocolate, cigarro, productos dianas, chicles y frutas.

Amparo de Jesús esta agradecida con Ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo confía en Dios que nuestra institución le pueda seguir ayudando a crecer.
texts.en:
Amparo de Jesús buys her products at six in the morning and later goes to her sales post to conduct business, where she finishes at four in the afternoon. She does this kind of work to pay for the upkeep of her home since she is a single mother of four children.

She is requesting this loan to buy products such as water, sodas, candy, chocolate, cigarettes, snack foods, gum, and fruit.

Amparo de Jesús is grateful to Ceprodel because they have helped her to grow her working capital. She trusts in God that our institution can continue helping her to grow.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, candy, chocolate, cigarettes, snack foods, gum, and fruit.

loans.name: Grethel Jahaira

texts.es: Grethel  Jahaira  se dedica a la venta de prenda de  oro  y  variedad de cosméticos el negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación pero también vende a domicilio  el cuenta con dos años de experiencia en dicha actividad, el objetivo del préstamo es la compra de prendas de diferentes estilo como  oro, plata, cosméticos con su experiencia ha logrado incrementar su número de clientes que solicitan sus productos.
texts.en: Grethel  Jahaira sells gold items and a variety of cosmetics. She runs her business out of her home, but she also visits customers' homes. She has two years' experience in this line of work. Her goal with this loan is to buy items in different styles such as gold and silver, as well as cosmetics. With her experience, she has been able to expand her number of customers, who are requesting her products.

loans.use: to buy gold, silver and cosmetics.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas son personas con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor estilo de vida y poder cambiar así el futuro de sus hijos. Su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa por medio de la ayuda mutua.
La presidenta, la señora Ilda vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comestible, gaseosas, etc. Ella tiene una cantina y junto con sus compañeras realizan constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre ellas y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, golosinas y demás insumos con los cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city of Caacupé.  They are people who very much want to get ahead and help their families have better standards of living and to be able to change their children’s futures.  Their goal is to reach the top level of the program through mutual support.

The group president, Ilda, lives with her husband and children.  She sells all types of food, soft-drinks, etc.  She has a bar and together with her fellow members carries out constant activities to encourage teamwork among them and to try to pay their installments ahead of time.

She asked for the loan to buy soft-drinks, snacks and other supplies to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 43 years old and married with five children. All of his children are in school. Fredrick is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from his cafeteria business. He has been earning his daily bread from this business for four years and has employed two people to assist him.

Fredrick is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy cereals and vegetables to prepare food. In the future, he hopes to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar originario de la  comunidad  Las Banderas es casado padre de 4 hijos y a cargo solo una de 15 años que estudia su secundaria en esa misma comunidad. El se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra cantera ambulante cesar dice que tiene 25 años de vender piedra el cual lo inicio con un camión que obtuvo con la venta de un ganado que le habían dado sus padres hoy  tiene 5 camiones obtenidos de ganancia del negocio y créditos q a obtenido de otras instituciones de los 5 camiones que tiene uno lo maneja el  y el resto el  4 paga choferes y ayudantes pues su negocio es la venta de piedra cantera que se ocupa para construcción de casas y paredes el vende ambulante en los departamentos  donde encuentre  clientes  que necesite piedra cantera pero ademas de eso el tiene su pequeño negocio de pulperia que son otros ingresos con los cuales ajusta para completar el sustento de su hogar . 

Cesar necesita este crédito para surtir la pulpería y comprar granos básicos, aceite, avenas, jabones, detergentes, huevos, pan etc. Dice que el crédito será de ayuda ya que lo podrá invertir en la pulpería  y ofrecer variedad de productos útiles para el consumo de su comunidad. También dice que sus planes futuros son comprar unas vacas para diversificar su negocio y como metas próximas comprar otro camión y hacer crecer su pulperia.
texts.en:
Cesar is a native of the community of Las Banderas.  He is married and has 4 children, but only his daughter currently lives with him—she is 15 years old and goes to secondary school in their community.  Cesar makes a living buying quarry stone and selling it as a mobile vendor.  He says that he has sold stone for 25 years.  He started out with one truck, which he bought with the proceeds from selling a herd of cattle that his parents had given him.  Today he has 5 trucks—he drives one of them and has hired drivers and assistants to operate the other trucks for him.  Cesar sells quarry stone for constructing houses and walls, and travels around the region in search of customers who need quarry stone.  He also has a small grocery store that provides additional income for supporting his family.

Cesar will use this loan to restock his grocery store by purchasing staple grains, oil, oats, soap, detergent, eggs, bread, and other items.  He says that the loan will allow him to invest in his grocery store and offer a variety of useful products for consumers in his community.  Cesar’s plans for the future are to purchase some cows so he can diversify his business, to buy another truck for his quarry stone business, and to expand his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, oil, oats, soap, detergent, eggs, and bread for his grocery store.

loans.name: Dominga Leisla

texts.es:
Dominga Leisla, inicia a ofertar su producto desde las 6:00 am su mayor demanda son clientes que le compra al por mayor ya que son propietario de pulperías, y cierra su negocio hasta las 5:00 pm según su movimiento y está ubicado en uno de los   mercado de la ciudad de León. 

 Ella solicita este crédito para  utilizarlo  en la  compra de productos  diana, cosméticos, caramelos, chocolates

 Dominga se siente muy conforme con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL por que ha logrado  aumentar su inventario,  siendo hoy en día una distribuidora de productos al por mayor y al detalle.
texts.en: Dominga Leisla starts selling her wares at 6am.  Most of her customers buy at wholesale because they are grocery store owners.  She closes at 5pm according to how much movement there is and it’s located in one of the city of León’s markets.  She requests this loan to buy Diana brand products, cosmetics, candy and chocolates.  Dominga is very satisfied with the loans CEPRODEL has granted her because she’s managed to increase her inventory so that today she sells products both at wholesale and at retail.

loans.use: to buy Diana products, cosmetics, candy and chocolates.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo con 21 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento de todos los días. Ellas  son independientes en sus labores, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para poder fomentar su compañerismo.
Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de aceites que se usan para los alimentos. Ella se define como una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder ayudar por medio de su trabajo a su familia. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y ser una gran comerciante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad y ofrecer a sus clientes su producto. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de kiva y de fundacion paraguaya.
texts.en:
This committee was formed with 21 hardworking, humble women who must earn their daily sustenance.  They work independently but also do joint activities to foster their fellowship.

Carmen is a very hardworking person and she tells us that she works selling oils that are used for cooking.  She defines herself as a person who very much wants to get ahead and to be able to help her family through her work.  Her goal is to continue growing and become a great merchant.

She’s asking for the loan to buy oil to have a variety available to offer her customers.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 47, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cleto, a driver, and mother to her four children. By the grace of God, Rosana has managed to support her children's schooling. She works hard to continually provide an income for her family’s everyday expenses.  

Rosana oversees the family’s their jeepney* transportation business. She has a vehicle that has the capacity for 14-16 people that earns a daily quota each day. Rosana’s regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP every day.

Rosana is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan to help continue her business operations, buy spare parts, and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Rosana dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* Curiously, jeepneys have a purely American origin. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, saw this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified it into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

** All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Shyrman

texts.ru:
Шырман – лидер группы «Акмарал», замужем, воспитывает 3 детей.  Шырман занимается продажей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес в 2002 году с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодня в активах Шырман  имеется ларек и товаров на сумму 40,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шырман обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Шырман планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Shyrman is the leader of the "Akmaral" group, married and has three children.  She is involved in selling food products, having started this business in 2002 with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Today Shyrman has a kiosk and goods valued at 40,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Shyrman requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise selection.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Sambun's Group

texts.en:
Sambun is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children in a village of the Mongkol Borey District, Cambodia. She has three daughters and one son. To earn a living in the village, she and her husband have been farming rice for several years. She also raises pigs to earn extra income. Sometimes she is employed by others.

Sambun has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, and she successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. The loans have helped her improve her standard of living. Now she can earn up to US$4.5 per day and manages to save around US$2 each day. Sambun and her group member, Khum, who has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Khmer riels each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy ten sacks of fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice healthfully and increase crop yields so she may earn more income to make her life better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Liliana Consuelo

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 37 años, se considera una persona de caracter normal, sencilla, trabajadora, responsable y muy atenta con sus clientes. Liliana vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Cotacachi que se encuentra a 25 minutos de Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura.

Liliana trabaja sola en su puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, negocio que ayuda a dar el estudio a sus hijos y sustentar algunos gastos de su hogar, es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra constante de tomates, lechuga, cebolla, col, manzana, papaya, uvas, sandías, naranjas, mandarinas por cajas debido a que tiene una gran demanda de clientes y le va muy bien.

Liliana sueña con que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales y no faltarles nunca en el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Liliana, 37, considers herself to be a person with a normal personality, unassuming, hardworking, responsible and very attentive to her customers.  Liliana lives with her husband and three children in Cotacachi which is located 25 minutes from Otavalo in Imbabura Province.

Liliana works alone in a fruit and vegetable stand, a business that helps her provide education for her children and cover some of the household expenses.  This is the third loan she’s requested from Fodemi and it will be used to recurrently buy tomatoes, lettuce, onions, cabbage, apples, papayas, grapes, watermelons, oranges and mandarins by the case because she has high customer demand and she does very well.

Liliana dreams with her children becoming good professionals and that they never lack their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia Maria se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas para subsistencia de su familia es una emprenderá con amplia experiencia en dicho actividad gracias al financiamiento que le ha brindado fundación león 2000, dicho prestamos lo invirtió en la compra de productos para el negocio. La Sra. Elia Maria está solicitando nuevamente el financiamiento para comprar productos  como: maíz, leña, comal, bolsas, entre otros.
texts.en: Elia María works making tortillas for her family’s sustenance.  She’s an entrepreneur with vast experience in this activity thanks to the loan she’s gotten from Fundación León 2000.  She used said loan to buy products for her business.  Elia María is asking for financing once again to buy product like: corn, firewood, a griddle and bags, among others.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewook, a griddle and bags, among others.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children. One of his children works. Since 2011, Kassem has owned a shop where he sells plastic materials. He has sufficient experience in this field to have a deep understanding of his local customers and their needs. Kassem has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Kassem is requesting 3,000 USD loan to redecorate his shop and install sliding doors. He aim is to gain more profits to provide him with the opportunity for a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his store and install sliding doors
